results.title: The Death of stars
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
This program examines the death of a star, in particular focusing on the death of our own star, the sun. Once the sun becomes a Red Giant, i.e. when the core compresses but the outer layer expands, the Earth will become uninhabitable. As a Red Giant, the sun will expand into the solar system, swallowing up the inner circle of planets. A star ends its life as a planetary nebulae and evolves into a White Dwarf. Some stars explode, particularly binary stars which results in the creation of supernovae.

results.title: The Death of Socrates
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Charles W. Russell and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description: A reconstruction of 399BC in Athens where Socrates, judged guilty of the corruption of youth and of refusal to recognize accepted gods of state faces execution according to Athenian law by drinking poison. Those who had been his main accusers said they did not desire his death but Anytus the politician who caused the trial refuses to reverse his judgement. In prison where a small group of friends have gathered Socrates speaks of the values he has cherished. Without being able to discourse daily about virtue and the greatest good of man he has no reason to live. He drinks poison and as friends weep, dies. Narrated by Walter Cronkite. Cast includes John Cassavetes as Plato, Robert Culp as Xenophon, E.G. Marshall as Aristophanes, Shepperd Strudwic as Crito, Milton Selzer as Melitus and Richard Kiley, Michael Higgins, Barry Jones, Philip Bourneuf, Grant Gordon and Victor Thorley.

results.title: The Death and Life of Marsha P. Johnson
results.creator_credit: Mark Blane, David France, James O'Donnell, Public Square Films, Ninety Thousand Words, Race Point Films, Faliro House Productions and Terasem Media & Films
results.brief_description: Describing herself as a ‘street queen,’ Johnson was a legendary fixture in New York City’s gay ghetto and a tireless voice for LGBT pride since the days of Stonewall, who along with fellow trans icon Sylvia Rivera, founded Street Transvestites Action Revolutionaries (S.T.A.R.), a trans activist group based in the heart of NYC’s Greenwich Village. Her death in 1992 was declared a suicide by the NYPD, but friends never accepted that version of events. Structured as a whodunit, with activist Victoria Cruz cast as detective and audience surrogate, The Death and Life of Marsha P. Johnson celebrates the lasting political legacy of Johnson, while seeking to finally solve the mystery of her unexplained death.

constellations_other.name: Welcome to Chechnya: tales through time
constellations_other.description: Documentary Welcome to Chechnya used ground-breaking deep fake technology to hide the identities of LGBTQ+ people fleeing a government-orchestrated genocide in Chechnya.

results.title: The Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis double
results.brief_description: Television party for Muscular Dystrophy - Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis are joined by many of their Hollywood cohorts including Danny Thomas, Eddie Cantor, Phil Silvers, Jane Wyman, Vic Damone, Spike Jones in a televised live benefit show in aid of muscular dystrophy. (Winner of 1982 Vira Award for best Vintage Comedy Show). “At war with the army” - The first Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis comedy together. Martin has girl trouble so Lewis decides to lend him a hand, the ensuing comedy is a result of Jerry’s questionable assistance, the early signs of Jerry Lewis’s comedy genius are clearly evident.

results.title: The Deadly cursed moon
results.brief_description: A one player, multi-level game where a knight must accumulate magic spheres to get to the next level without being hit by the deadly cursed moon.

results.title: The Dead zone
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Debra Hill, Rastar Productions and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Faithfully adapted from the Stephen King novel of the same name, this is the chilling story of a man who wakes up from a five-year coma with the extraordinary power to see visions of the past, present and, most frightening, the future. A tense and thought provoking production in which Walken gives one of his most intense and believable performances.

results.title: The Dead Weight of a Quarrel Hangs
results.brief_description: Walid Raad’s Dead weight of a quarrel hangs examines the legacy of the Lebanese Civil War through the stories omitted or seen as unimportant in the official histories. Remnants of film and photography, snapshots and surveillance video footage are transformed to create an archive to “another” Lebanese Civil War.

results.title: The Dead next door
results.creator_credit: J.R. Bookwalter, Amsco Studios and Suburban Tempe
results.brief_description: J.R. Bookwalter’s The Dead Next Door is more than a passing homage to director George A. Romero’s ‘Living Dead’ trilogy. Shot on super-8 and partly financed by director Sam Raimi, this super low budget effort might be creaky at times but enthusiastically serves up the gore to considerable effect. The thin plot concerns a crack team of soldiers know as The Zombie squad who are called in to contain a virus that is bringing the dead back to life. Of course the zombies aren’t content with just being re-animated, as they chew their way through the human race leaving a messy trail behind them. Complicating the commandos squads mission further is an insane religious cult whose sole aim is to keep the zombies fed and alive in preparation for the final day of reckoning when the dead will finally replace the living. Cast includes Peter Ferry, Bogdan Pecic, Jolie Jackunas, Robert Kokai.

results.title: The Dead mother = La Madre muerta [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Juanma Bajo Ulloa and Gasteizko Zinema
results.brief_description: A thief, a cold blooded murder, a child witness and a jealous girlfriend provide the scenario for this intense and evocative psycho-thriller by second-time director Juanma Bajo Ulloa (Butterfly wings = Alas de mariposa, 1991). The thief, Ismael (Karra Elejalde) is interrupted during a robbery when the woman of the house unexpectedly returns. Without any hesitation, Ismael proceeds to cold-bloodedly kill the woman and only as he makes his escape does he realise that the murder has been silently witnessed by the woman’s young daughter, Leire. Many years later Leire (Ana Alvarez) and Ismael’s paths cross. Terrified that he may be exposed by the truth, Ismael decides to kidnap Leire and hold her prisoner in his derelict squat, much to his girlfriend Maite’s (Lio) annoyance and frustration. Leire, however, having been traumatised by the witnessing of her mother’s murder, has grown up as a mute. As Ismael’s interest in Liere turns from fear to an almost obsessive attraction, Liere unwittingly finds herself becoming part of a complex and dangerous love triangle, which can only lead to a twisted and violent conclusion, particularly in light of Maite’s extreme jealousy towards Leire. A film of suspense and intrigue peppered with moments of dark humour and acted by a superb cast including Silvia Marso, Elena Irureta, Ramon Barea. Winner of many international film festival awards (Montreal, Stockholm, Sao Paulo etc) including Best Film, Best Director, Best Actress (Ana Alvarez) and Best Actor (Karra Elejalde). In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Dead Lands
results.brief_description: Hongi, a Maori chieftain’s teenage son, must avenge his father’s murder in order to bring peace and honour to the souls of his loved ones after his tribe is slaughtered through an act of treachery.

constellations_other.name: The Lumière brothers
constellations_other.description: The Lumière brothers understood the potential of cinema to be exhibited theatrically. Only one person could watch films through Thomas Edison's Kinetograph, while Auguste and Louis exhibited their films to thousands with Cinematographe.

results.description: Hongi, a Maori chieftain’s teenage son, must avenge his father’s murder in order to bring peace and honour to the souls of his loved ones after his tribe is slaughtered through an act of treachery. Vastly outnumbered by a band of villains led by Wirepa, Hongi’s only hope is to pass through the feared and forbidden “Dead Lands” and forge an uneasy alliance with a mysterious warrior, a ruthless fighter who has ruled the area for years.
